name: Choy-Lee-Fut Kung-Fu Warrior
description:
He raised from the Hell and sighed. On his face the wrath of a demon and the ambition of thousand devils. He sprouted like a bad seed in the temple of Shaolin, whose walls lodged the best fighters of all times. The destiny has decided that the last hour for the good has arrived, because the yellow devil seized the original manuscript where Cheng Heung wrote the art of the Choy Lee Fut.

Supported on the force of the five magical animals, the speed and the technique of a good apprentice, we will cross the temple of Shaolin until finding the monster and recovering the scroll. We are expert in punches, we handle the sabre with ferocity and make the flexible lance more penetrating and versatile. And all thanks to the Chi. As first action, we will have the possibility of training with the Dummies (the wood men), where we will practice the distance, the speed and the use of complementary techniques. From which we will get up ourselves into the dynamics of the fight and the confrontations hand-to-hand with the partisans of the evildoer.

The movements are varied, all of them based on the Kung-Fu techniques. With different arms we will be able to execute different movements using the same keys. Everything depends on the animal that our personage will adopt. The graphical theme also changes according to the fight scenes, including the face of the old man that observes us.
alsoFor: Amstrad CPC, DOS, MSX | Combined View

shot.caption: The game menu is simple, Start or Redefine keys. The company name 'Positive' wanders all over the screen while the game waits for input
Practice The Power of the Fist' with Chin Jong
Unarmed combat is first and many different strikes are possible

The game is heavily biased to the right. 
The character does not face the other way when moving to the left, perhaps that's just a ninja trick
He can even kick from the ground
He can kick to the left as well but always returns to face right. When the energy bars in the centre hit zero the game returns the player to the 'Practice the power of the ... screen
Practice The Power of the Tiger' with Chin Jong
The power of the tiger involves waving a sword around a lot
Practice The Power of the Dragon' with Gwang Jong
Fist to fist fight with the Spirit of the Dragon
This session is about fighting two opponents. The energy bars in the centre now move independently, one for each combatant
Staying in the middle of the screen means being attacked by both opponents. An opponent seems to only come past the centre line if their comrade is forced off-screen
When Choy gets up he has full health but his opponents do not. Nice move this but Choy's on his way to a second knockdown
An invitation to continue. If nothing is entered the player is returned to the game menu
